summary: The 'Clear the Reckless Obstructions And Dangers on Streets Act' (Clear the ROADS Act) amends Title 23 of the United States Code to address roadway obstructions. It directs the Secretary of Transportation to withhold 10% of certain federal funds from states that fail to make reasonable efforts to prohibit individuals from recklessly obstructing lawful vehicle transportation on Federal-aid highways, endangering public safety. The Secretary is mandated to issue implementing regulations within 180 days.
